com.cpirvu

Class ExecutionCycle

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.cpirvu.ExecutionCycle
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    PrintableExecution, java.lang.Runnable

    class ExecutionCycle
extends java.lang.Object
implements PrintableExecution, java.lang.Runnable
    This class is a single execution cycle that completely processes a single file. It also implements the Runnable interface to help in multi-thread scenarios.

    • Field Detail

      • LOCK

        private static final java.lang.Object LOCK
        Single shared lock of ExecutionCycle calls. This is used so that the output (calls to System.out print()) is synchronized and human intelligible.

      • COUNT

        This will count all the cycles in the program.

        public void printProcessingTime()

        Specified by:
        printProcessingTime in interface PrintableExecution
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if this cycle never been called

      • getProcessingTime

        public long getProcessingTime()
        Description copied from interface: PrintableExecution
        Method that returns a long containing the time of how long the implementing class has been processing a request.
        Specified by:
        getProcessingTime in interface PrintableExecution
        Returns:
        the total processing time of this cycle.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if this cycle has never been called or it is still running.

      • getProcessingTimeUntilNow

        public long getProcessingTimeUntilNow()
        When this cycle is not running, it will call getProcessingTime().
        Returns:
        the current processing time of this cycle.

      • run

        public void run()
        This method will chain the executions to completely transform a file from Grayscale to Binary. The steps consist of calling the following methods in order: - ImageFileReading.execute() - ImageBinarization.execute() - ImageFileWriting.execute() If any of them fail to complete successfully, then an error message will be printed that will point at the exact failed step.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable

      • printExecutionCycle

        private void printExecutionCycle(java.lang.String string)
        Method that helps in printing the current cycle number followed by the given string.
        Parameters:
        string - the string in front of which the current execution cycle number must be printed

      • printExecutionCycle

        private void printExecutionCycle()
        Method that prints the current execution cycle number. To be used followed by specific events.

      • executeStepAndReturnProcessingTime

        private long executeStepAndReturnProcessingTime(ExecutionStep step)
        This method will execute the given ExecutionStep, print and return it's processing time.
        Parameters:
        step - the ExecutionStep to execute.
        Returns:
        long containing the processing time of this step.
